org.jamesframework.core.subset

Class SubsetProblem<DataType extends IntegerIdentifiedData>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jamesframework.core.problems.AbstractProblem<SubsetSolution,DataType>
      • org.jamesframework.core.subset.SubsetProblem<DataType>
  • Type Parameters:
    DataType - underlying data type, should implement the interface IntegerIdentifiedData
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Problem<SubsetSolution>

    public class SubsetProblem<DataType extends IntegerIdentifiedData>
extends AbstractProblem<SubsetSolution,DataType>
    High-level subset problem consisting of data, an objective and possibly some constraints (see AbstractProblem). All items in the data set are identified using a unique integer ID so that any subset selection problem comes down to selection of a subset of these IDs. The solution type is fixed to SubsetSolution and the data type can be set to any implementation of the IntegerIdentifiedData interface. When creating the problem, the minimum and maximum allowed subset size are specified. Methods are provided to create random or empty subset solutions, based on the IDs of the items that are retrieved from the underlying data.
    Author:
    Herman De Beukelaer

    • Constructor Detail

      • SubsetProblem

        public SubsetProblem(Objective<? super SubsetSolution,? super DataType> objective,
                     DataType data,
                     int minSubsetSize,
                     int maxSubsetSize,
                     boolean sortedIDs)
        Creates a new subset problem with given objective, data and minimum/maximum subset size. Both objective and data are not allowed to be null, an exception will be thrown if they are. Any objective designed to evaluate subset solutions (or more general solutions) using the specified data type (or more general data) is accepted. The minimum and maximum subset size should be contained in [0,n] where n is the number of items in the given data from which a subset is to be selected. Also, the minimum size should be smaller than or equal to the maximum size. If sortedIDs is true, any subset solution generated by this problem (random, empty, ...) will store the underlying IDs in sorted sets.
        Parameters:
        objective - objective function, can not be null
        data - underlying data, can not be null
        minSubsetSize - minimum subset size (should be ≥ 0 and ≤ maximum subset size)
        maxSubsetSize - maximum subset size (should be ≥ minimum subset size and ≤ number of items in underlying data)
        sortedIDs - indicates whether IDs are sorted in generated subset solutions
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if objective or data is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if an invalid minimum or maximum subset size is specified

      • SubsetProblem

        public SubsetProblem(Objective<? super SubsetSolution,? super DataType> objective,
                     DataType data,
                     int minSubsetSize,
                     int maxSubsetSize)
        Creates a new subset problem with given objective, data and minimum/maximum subset size. Both objective and data are not allowed to be null, an exception will be thrown if they are. Any objective designed to evaluate subset solutions (or more general solutions) using the specified data type (or more general data) is accepted. The minimum and maximum subset size should be contained in [0,n] where n is the number of items in the given data from which a subset is to be selected. Also, the minimum size should be smaller than or equal to the maximum size. Generated subset solutions do not guarantee any order of IDs.
        Parameters:
        objective - objective function, can not be null
        data - underlying data, can not be null
        minSubsetSize - minimum subset size (should be ≥ 0 and ≤ maximum subset size)
        maxSubsetSize - maximum subset size (should be ≥ minimum subset size and ≤ number of items in underlying data)
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if objective or data is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if an invalid minimum or maximum subset size is specified

      • SubsetProblem

        public SubsetProblem(Objective<? super SubsetSolution,? super DataType> objective,
                     DataType data,
                     int fixedSubsetSize)
        Creates a subset problem with fixed subset size. Equivalent to calling
         SubsetProblem p = new SubsetProblem(objective, data, fixedSubsetSize, fixedSubsetSize);
        The fixed subset size should be contained in [0,n] where n is the number of items in the given data from which a subset is to be selected. Generated subset solutions do not guarantee any order of IDs.
        Parameters:
        objective - objective function, can not be null
        data - underlying data, can not be null
        fixedSubsetSize - fixed subset size
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if objective or data is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if an invalid fixed subset size is specified

        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if data is null

      • createRandomSolution

        public SubsetSolution createRandomSolution()
        Create a random solution within the allowed minimum and maximum subset size. The set of all IDs is retrieved from the underlying data and a random subset of these IDs is selected.
        Returns:
        random subset solution within minimum and maximum size

      • createEmptySubsetSolution

        public SubsetSolution createEmptySubsetSolution()
        Creates an empty subset solution in which no IDs are selected. The set of all IDs is obtained from the underlying data and passed to the created empty solution.
        Returns:
        empty subset solution with no selected IDs

      • validate

        public SubsetValidation validate(SubsetSolution solution)
        Validate a subset solution. The returned validation object indicates whether the solution passed constraint validation, possibly also requiring that it has a valid size.
        Specified by:
        validate in interface Problem<SubsetSolution>
        Overrides:
        validate in class AbstractProblem<SubsetSolution,DataType extends IntegerIdentifiedData>
        Parameters:
        solution - solution to validate
        Returns:
        subset validation

      • validate

        public SubsetValidation validate(Move<? super SubsetSolution> move,
                                 SubsetSolution curSolution,
                                 Validation curValidation)
        Validate a move to be applied to the current subset solution of a local search (delta validation). A subset problem can only perform delta validation for moves of type SubsetMove. If the received move has a different type an IncompatibleDeltaValidationException is thrown.
        Specified by:
        validate in interface Problem<SubsetSolution>
        Overrides:
        validate in class AbstractProblem<SubsetSolution,DataType extends IntegerIdentifiedData>
        Parameters:
        move - subset move to be validated
        curSolution - current solution
        curValidation - current validation
        Returns:
        validation of modified subset solution
        Throws:
        IncompatibleDeltaValidationException - if the received move is not of type SubsetMove or if the delta validation of any mandatory constraint is not compatible with the received move type

      • getMinSubsetSize

        public int getMinSubsetSize()
        Get the minimum subset size.
        Returns:
        minimum subset size

      • setMinSubsetSize

        public void setMinSubsetSize(int minSubsetSize)
        Set the minimum subset size. Specified size should be ≥ 1 and ≤ the current maximum subset size.
        Parameters:
        minSubsetSize - new minimum subset size
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if an invalid minimum size is given

      • getMaxSubsetSize

        public int getMaxSubsetSize()
        Get the maximum subset size.
        Returns:
        maximum subset size

      • setMaxSubsetSize

        public void setMaxSubsetSize(int maxSubsetSize)
        Set the maximum subset size. Specified size should be ≥ the current minimum subset size and ≤ the number of items in the underlying data.
        Parameters:
        maxSubsetSize - new maximum subset size
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if an invalid maximum size is given
